intro: Aconogonon divaricatum var. micranthum, commonly known as the narrow-flowered aconogonon, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, tubular flowers. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers typically bloom in clusters and are predominantly blue or violet in color. This species is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
